steps: Add a few drops of iodine to a small milk sample; blue color suggests starch.
Shake milk in a bottle; stable thick foam may indicate detergent.
Drop milk on a smooth surface; rapid spread suggests added water.
Mix a teaspoon in warm water; artificial dye may separate and color the water.
Add iodine; blue color indicates starch.
Add a spoon of honey to water; pure honey settles, adulterated dissolves quickly.
safety: Do not feed honey to infants <1 year.
